text: Lam Pou-chuen (, 10 October 1951 - 2 January 2015) was a Hong Kong voice actor. His career began in 1971. He was known for voicing Doraemon for over twenty years and dubbing many blockbuster movies into Cantonese. Lam was born in Portuguese Macau. He was a Buddhist. Lam died at the age of 63 from diabetes problems at his home in Hong Kong. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1951 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Buddhists Category:Disease-related deaths in Hong Kong Category:Deaths from diabetes Category:Hong Kong actors Category:Movie actors Category:Television actors Category:Chinese voice actors
title: Lam Pou-chuen
